dados.info:
This house, located on the edge of the historic centre of Abrantes, was probably Raul Lino's first project in the city of Abrantes. It was the house/studio of José Serra da Motta, a lawyer and watercolour painter.
The property is set on a steeply sloping plot of land at the junction of Rua Luís de Camões and Rua do Montepio Abrantino. It has two floors and includes an attic. The building features a porch supported on five columns and facing west, dormer windows that provide natural light to the attic, two large chimneys decorated with red clay ceramic elements similar to those used in the staircase at the rear of the house.

Raul Lino's intervention corresponds to the expansion of the 19th century manor house, integrated in the farm located in Barreiras do Tejo.  The architect annexed, to the pre-existing main building, a construction from which resulted a symmetrical composition in relation to a central body with a porch loggia and two towers flanking the set, one of them intended for a chapel.

In 1923 Raul Lino was commissioned to expand and alter a single-story dwelling in the town of Tramagal, with the addition of a floor and attic. In the pre-existing building, the original compartmentalization was also reformulated, and a porch was added flanking one of the flanks of the dwelling. However, it is likely that the building was not built according to the project proposed by Raul Lino.

dados.titulo: Largo General Avelar Machado e Rua Montepio Abrantino
dados.localizacao: Largo General Avelar Machado (at the junction of Rua Montepio Abrantino and Rua de Nossa Senhora da Conceição)
dados.tipologia: Headquarters of cultural and recreational association (original plan)
dados.info:
The building was designed to house the headquarters of the Sociedade da Assembleia de Abrantes.  It is located in a steeply sloping area on the edge of the Abrantes historic centre at the junction of Rua do Montepio Abrantino and Rua de Nossa Senhora da Conceição. It was inaugurated in 1928 and currently remains the property of the Sociedade da Assembleia de Abrantes, a city's elite club founded in 1924. 
The main entrance to the building, in Largo General Avelar Machado, is protected by a porch of cylindrical columns featuring a wainscot of polychrome tiles. The two adjacent but distinct north-facing porches, the window lattices in the rooms on the south façade, the ceramic tile roof and the Portuguese-style eaves, the stone obelisks on the roof and the chimneys are worthy of note.  
Inside there is a ballroom with a stage, a reading room and three games rooms, as well as a kitchen with pantry and sanitary conveniences. The slope of the land was used to accommodate commercial premises and warehouses.

This building takes as a starting point a pre-existing one and has undergone numerous renovations throughout its history.
The first intervention by Raul Lino dates from 1924 and consists of an extension in which the second floor and the attic were added in a similar style to the original building.  Later, in 1942, Raul Lino designed the new configuration of the façade windows.

dados.tipologia: Single-family Housing (original plan from 1924; extension plan, 1948)
dados.info:
The building, originally designed in 1924, is located in a street on the edge of the historic centre and consists of a two-storey building with a basement positioned centrally.
In 1948, an extension project was requested  and a structure was erected in the plot adjacent to the existing building, which also underwent, as part of this campaign of works, some changes in room layout and distribution.

In 1928, Raul Lino designed the pedestal for the bust of General Avelar Machado (1848-1909) by Ângelo Teixeira. The set was inaugurated in 1929 and is located in the square in front of the headquarters building of the Sociedade da Assembleia de Abrantes (the main entrance to this building).

dados.tipologia: Single-family Housing (original plan from 1929; extension plan, 1963)
dados.info:
The original plan for this residential building located near the Jardim da República in Abrantes was drawn up by Raul Lino in 1929.
In 1963, an extension took place in the adjoining plot, which resulted in the construction of a separate building, maintaining the pre-existing façade composition.
The plan of this building consists of an urban dwelling over two floors and has an open loggia on the first floor in a triple arcade overlooking Rua do Arcediago.

dados.localizacao: Rua General Manuel António Mourato, no. 11
dados.info: This project by Raul Lino proposed the enlargement of a pre-existing ground floor building located in the old town of Abrantes in a narrow and deep plot. Two floors were added to the existing building connected by an interior staircase.

Raul Lino's plan develops from an existing three-storey building located in the historic centre of Abrantes, in which the architect changed the composition of the third floor and converted the original single window opening into two. Two side openings were also added on the first and second floors, which in Raul Lino's project had a circular shape, but which were made into a rhombus (as evidenced by the current façade).

dados.localizacao: Rua de Santa Isabel nos. 28 and 30
dados.info: Raul Lino's plan is developed from an existing two-storey building (ground floor +1) in downtown Abrantes to which one floor was added.  The ground floor was intended for commercial premises and the upper floors for residential purposes.

dados.localizacao: Alferrarede, Rua do Porto Taínho, nº 24
dados.info: The building was implanted in a plot of land located in the urban limit of Alferrarede, overlooking the river Tagus. The project reflects a Single-family Housing program, which materialized in a small two-storey house, whose main entrance is protected by the porch accessed through a small set of stairs.

In this project, Raul Lino is commissioned to design the renovation of an existing three-storey building with a tiled façade.  The plan includes a number of alterations inside the house, with the aim of adapting the interior spaces and improving its comfort and usability. On the outside, three dormer windows were added, two facing the patio and the other in the centre of the main façade facing the street.

This small project was for the construction of a garage in place of a pre-existing structure - a "shed"- close to the residential building that Raul Lino designed in 1924 for Guilherme Moura Neves, and which was later enlarged (in 1948). The project concerned the construction,  on a narrow plot, of a garage to serve the dwelling. The unevenness of the terrain has made it possible to design outbuildings with separate accesses.

The project concerns the construction of a two-storey residential building with a basement in a markedly horizontal layout.
In the building, it is worth noting the metal railings of the balconies (similar to the metal railings of the porch balcony of the Assembleia de Abrantes building), the stonework that marks the openings of the balcony windows and the doors, as well as the building's chimney.

The alteration plan proposed by Raul Lino for this residential building located near the S. Vicente church and Largo da Ferraria includes important modifications such as the reconfiguration of its main façade with the removal of the balustrade and a new cornice ceiling. Dormer windows were also added and the frames, joinery and metalwork of the door and window frames were redesigned and replaced.

dados.titulo: Cemitério de S. Miguel do Rio Torto
dados.localizacao: Cemitério de S. Miguel do Rio Torto, Carvalhal
dados.info: This mausoleum was erected in memory of João Augusto da Silva Martins, who died in 1924 and was a prominent figure in Carvalhal (Parish of S. Miguel do Rio Torto), where he kept in operation the Abrantes Milling Company, opened in 1903. The building, in austere style, with classical forms, consists of two bodies with different volumes: the first corresponds to a portico whose entrance is flanked by two columns, and that precedes the second body, the chapel, a space of longitudinal plan, simple and with coverage of two waters, illuminated by a window on the main facade and a gap in the opposite wall.
